------=_Part_1699770_441978467.1574198128714
Content-Type: text/plain; charset=UTF-8
Content-Transfer-Encoding: quoted-printable

 
We all miss it and the fun we had.=C2=A0 It doesn't mean there aren't mor=
e forums out there to be had fun in and enjoy selves.=C2=A0 There's Discord=
, for thsoe old timers there's MUDs and MUSHes..There are other online acti=
ve forums such as rpnation.com.=C2=A0 Discord has a lot of active ones.=C2=
=A0 Rpol.net is highly rated.=C2=A0 There are things out there if you want =
to do forum, PBEM.. Just get looking!=C2=A0 And games and fun will always b=
e there and be missed.=C2=A0 One last hurrah, remember the good times, the =
creativity, and the bad ones.=C2=A0 Stay in touch wiht people.
Till the day=
 when all are one

 =C2=A0   
OOC: Hello. It's been a long time. I don't kn=
ow how many people I once knew are still here. I don't know who is listenin=
g now. But I'll speak anyway. I'm C. V. Reynolds. I was once known as Souls=
tice Omega. Some people called me THECODE. Then I was Hollywood Narrator. A=
nd briefly Roland the Last Gunslinger. How are you all? I've had hard times=
, but I'm well.




As the time of YahooGroups deleting its archives draws =
near, I reminisce of days long gone. I'm archiving the group using the Yaho=
o-Group Archiver script. But I still feel melancholy knowing the archive wi=
ll be gone. The connection I had to NBW is fading away. Soon the thing that=
 kept me bound to the member's list will be gone. So I knew I needed to wri=
te this message.




I joined Neo Beast Wars during its peak many years ago=
 now. Back when the website had that Transformers the Movie midi playing. I=
t was completely by chance I discovered NBW, and thus my life was forever c=
hanged. I was a poster and accidental troll in Ben Yee's bwtf message board=
 during the old days. While I was fretting over everyone hating me, I notic=
ed a message board post advertising NBW RPG. This was in the days when Ben =
Yee's board could contain few topics at once. That topic only lasted for th=
e day. But in that coincidental moment I reached out and seized the moment.=
 I became a NBW member. My first character was Sinesis. He was a moder. Hah=
a. :3




I had minimal experience writing fanfic at that point. It was all=
 trash. But I looked forward to having fun with people. Writing for somethi=
ng I loved (and still love now, in ALL forms): Transformers. Unfortunately,=
 it was a very hard road for me. I was unpopular in NBW during my awkward a=
ttempts to learn etiquette. I didn't fit in at all. And I certainly had tro=
uble learning the rules early on. Over time I worked hard to earn respect, =
though I resented some of the hard moderators of the time. Certain mods wer=
e very rude to me and others and I haven't forgotten it. But I know I was v=
ery annoying too. I eventually found common ground with some other members =
and formed some friendships. Alloran. Lurker Abyss. RoboRick. Dachande. The=
 late MiniMe316. It's been so long. I might have forgotten some. I apologiz=
e. It was not intentional. In one way or another, I drifted apart from all =
these friends. I haven't heard from them in many years. For some of those i=
t's better this way.




I met a lot of people in NBW. I couldn't possibly =
name them all. They were a fun bunch and I liked posting with most of them.=
 But it's fair to say I never fit in like I wanted. It seemed everything I =
did ruffled someone's feathers. Even giving characters wrestling moves or a=
 human name like "Dan" angered people. Despite actual Transformers fiction =
doing the same things several times. There were people who insisted on call=
ing me THECODE because of my old e-mail address. Despite my pleading with t=
hem to not... I couldn't figure out how to change my message name back then=
. For a while I was content. It was fun, but nerve-racking at the same time=
. In the end I never did "fit in" like I had dreamed I would.




But I yea=
rned for more, and so I formed my own Transformers RPG. SSO RPG took inspir=
ation from NBW and wouldn't have existed without it. It later fell apart. I=
 was ill-equipped to run a group and all my own members back-stabbed me in =
resentment. Ha. Still, I wouldn't give up. I later formed DBZSF with my sis=
ter. A DBZ-based RPG, also taking inspiration from NBW. DBZSF had a good ru=
n, but I've been the only one writing for it for many years now. But it was=
 still active when I had the courage to finally leave NBW for good. My crip=
pling depression at the time helped my decision. I mouthed off to one of my=
 antagonists on my way out. Big time. Looking back, I see something was wro=
ng with my mental condition at the time. Not a glorious or mature exit... t=
o say the least. But being mentally unwell sometimes makes you a bomb ready=
 to explode... I guess. I don't want to excuse my detonation, though. I did=
n't actually unsubscribe, but I was true to my word about my leave. I never=
 posted for NBW again. I recall someone saying I'd come crawling back in a =
couple of weeks. That he enjoyed "listening to me whine" or so. Much as I m=
issed NBW later, I'm happy to have proved him wrong. >:3




But now the dr=
eam is over. All the RPGs have had their sundowns. I'm saddened, but from t=
hat wasteland I found hope. Like a rose that grows from the wreckage. I use=
d all the experience I gathered from my years in the RPGs to take the next =
step. I became a novelist. I have three books published on Amazon under the=
 name C. V. Reynolds. cvreynolds.net is my very simplistic website. I've ac=
complished what sometimes seems like a dream to me. Through all the years o=
f depression and illnesses I've suffered, I persevered. I have something to=
 show for it all.




But I never forgot my roots. And I know the truth. Wi=
thout DBZSF (and my beloved Trigun), there would be no novels. Without SSO =
RPG, there would be no DBZSF. Without NBW, there would be no... any of thos=
e things. And so I owe a debt of gratitude to NBW. For showing me a way. Fo=
r having a place for me, no matter how thorny it sometimes felt. For changi=
ng my life forever. To think it all came down to that one member who I no l=
onger recall. Who posted that message on that forum at the right time for m=
e to see it. And for NBW to form the steps that would take me to the stars.=





So thank you NBW for everything you've done for me despite giving me s=
ome bad times sometimes. And thanks for the good times I did have posting f=
un things with the members here. Thank you for giving me the training I nee=
ded to become something more. Thanks to all the members who had good times =
with me and were friendly and helpful to me. And thanks to other members th=
at put up with my annoying younger self. Thanks to the mods for never follo=
wing through on those threats to ban me. ;P Thanks for the history and than=
ks for the memories. Thank you for the inspiration for DBZSF and for feedin=
g my desire to write and my hope for people to read my work. Thanks for cha=
nging my life.




Thank you. And goodbye... for now.




For love and for =
peace,

~C. V. Reynolds (Soulstice Omega)~






"And grasp our hands toget=
her we feel we are one result."
    
------=_Part_1699770_441978467.1574198128714
Content-Type: text/html; charset=UTF-8
Content-Transfer-Encoding: quoted-printable

v><div>We all miss it and the fun we had.  It doesn't mean there aren'=

.  Rpol.net is highly rated.  There are things out there if you w=
ant to do forum, PBEM.. Just get looking!  And games and fun will alwa=
ys be there and be missed.  One last hurrah, remember the good times, =
the creativity, and the bad ones.  Stay in touch wiht people.</div><di=
v><br></div><div dir=3D"ltr" data-setdir=3D"false">Till the day when all ar=
e one<br></div><div><br></div>

      <p>OOC: Hello=
. It's been a long time. I don't know how many people I once knew are still=
 here. I don't know who is listening now. But I'll speak anyway. I'm C. V. =
Reynolds. I was once known as Soulstice Omega. Some people called me THECOD=
E. Then I was Hollywood Narrator. And briefly Roland the Last Gunslinger. H=
ow are you all? I've had hard times, but I'm well.</p><p><br clear=3D"none"=
></p><p>As the time of YahooGroups deleting its archives draws near, I remi=
nisce of days long gone. I'm archiving the group using the Yahoo-Group Arch=
iver script. But I still feel melancholy knowing the archive will be gone. =
The connection I had to NBW is fading away. Soon the thing that kept me bou=
nd to the member's list will be gone. So I knew I needed to write this mess=
age.</p><p><br clear=3D"none"></p><p>I joined Neo Beast Wars during its pea=
k many years ago now. Back when the website had that Transformers the Movie=
 midi playing. It was completely by chance I discovered NBW, and thus my li=
fe was forever changed. I was a poster and accidental troll in Ben Yee's bw=
tf message board during the old days. While I was fretting over everyone ha=
ting me, I noticed a message board post advertising NBW RPG. This was in th=
e days when Ben Yee's board could contain few topics at once. That topic on=
ly lasted for the day. But in that coincidental moment I reached out and se=
ized the moment. I became a NBW member. My first character was Sinesis. He =
was a moder. Haha. :3</p><p><br clear=3D"none"></p><p>I had minimal experie=
nce writing fanfic at that point. It was all trash. But I looked forward to=
 having fun with people. Writing for something I loved (and still love now,=
 in ALL forms): Transformers. Unfortunately, it was a very hard road for me=
. I was unpopular in NBW during my awkward attempts to learn etiquette. I d=
idn't fit in at all. And I certainly had trouble learning the rules early o=
n. Over time I worked hard to earn respect, though I resented some of the h=
ard moderators of the time. Certain mods were very rude to me and others an=
d I haven't forgotten it. But I know I was very annoying too. I eventually =
found common ground with some other members and formed some friendships. Al=
loran. Lurker Abyss. RoboRick. Dachande. The late MiniMe316. It's been so l=
ong. I might have forgotten some. I apologize. It was not intentional. In o=
ne way or another, I drifted apart from all these friends. I haven't heard =
from them in many years. For some of those it's better this way.</p><p><br =
clear=3D"none"></p><p>I met a lot of people in NBW. I couldn't possibly nam=
e them all. They were a fun bunch and I liked posting with most of them. Bu=
t it's fair to say I never fit in like I wanted. It seemed everything I did=
 ruffled someone's feathers. Even giving characters wrestling moves or a hu=
man name like "Dan" angered people. Despite actual Transformers fiction doi=
ng the same things several times. There were people who insisted on calling=
 me THECODE because of my old e-mail address. Despite my pleading with them=
 to not... I couldn't figure out how to change my message name back then. F=
or a while I was content. It was fun, but nerve-racking at the same time. I=
n the end I never did "fit in" like I had dreamed I would.</p><p><br clear=
=3D"none"></p><p>But I yearned for more, and so I formed my own Transformer=
s RPG. SSO RPG took inspiration from NBW and wouldn't have existed without =
it. It later fell apart. I was ill-equipped to run a group and all my own m=
embers back-stabbed me in resentment. Ha. Still, I wouldn't give up. I late=
r formed DBZSF with my sister. A DBZ-based RPG, also taking inspiration fro=
m NBW. DBZSF had a good run, but I've been the only one writing for it for =
many years now. But it was still active when I had the courage to finally l=
eave NBW for good. My crippling depression at the time helped my decision. =
I mouthed off to one of my antagonists on my way out. Big time. Looking bac=
k, I see something was wrong with my mental condition at the time. Not a gl=
orious or mature exit... to say the least. But being mentally unwell someti=
mes makes you a bomb ready to explode... I guess. I don't want to excuse my=
 detonation, though. I didn't actually unsubscribe, but I was true to my wo=
rd about my leave. I never posted for NBW again. I recall someone saying I'=
d come crawling back in a couple of weeks. That he enjoyed "listening to me=
 whine" or so. Much as I missed NBW later, I'm happy to have proved him wro=
ng. >:3</p><p><br clear=3D"none"></p><p>But now the dream is over. All t=
he RPGs have had their sundowns. I'm saddened, but from that wasteland I fo=
und hope. Like a rose that grows from the wreckage. I used all the experien=
ce I gathered from my years in the RPGs to take the next step. I became a n=
ovelist. I have three books published on Amazon under the name C. V. Reynol=
ds. cvreynolds.net is my very simplistic website. I've accomplished what so=
metimes seems like a dream to me. Through all the years of depression and i=
llnesses I've suffered, I persevered. I have something to show for it all.<=
/p><p><br clear=3D"none"></p><p>But I never forgot my roots. And I know the=
 truth. Without DBZSF (and my beloved Trigun), there would be no novels. Wi=
thout SSO RPG, there would be no DBZSF. Without NBW, there would be no... a=
ny of those things. And so I owe a debt of gratitude to NBW. For showing me=
 a way. For having a place for me, no matter how thorny it sometimes felt. =
For changing my life forever. To think it all came down to that one member =
who I no longer recall. Who posted that message on that forum at the right =
time for me to see it. And for NBW to form the steps that would take me to =
the stars.</p><p><br clear=3D"none"></p><p>So thank you NBW for everything =
you've done for me despite giving me some bad times sometimes. And thanks f=
or the good times I did have posting fun things with the members here. Than=
k you for giving me the training I needed to become something more. Thanks =
to all the members who had good times with me and were friendly and helpful=
 to me. And thanks to other members that put up with my annoying younger se=
lf. Thanks to the mods for never following through on those threats to ban =
me. ;P Thanks for the history and thanks for the memories. Thank you for th=
e inspiration for DBZSF and for feeding my desire to write and my hope for =
people to read my work. Thanks for changing my life.</p><p><br clear=3D"non=
e"></p><p>Thank you. And goodbye... for now.</p><p><br clear=3D"none"></p><=
p>For love and for peace,</p><p>~C. V. Reynolds (Soulstice Omega)~</p><p><b=
r clear=3D"none"></p><p><span></span></p><p>"And grasp our hands together w=
e feel we are one result."</p>
